Steps to reproduce:

This is supported on Windows, Mac and Android, but not on Freedesktop platforms, i.e. GNOME, KDE and other desktop environments under Linux and other OSes. Since the code already exists for other systems, it shouldn't be hard to implement for these (it's in toolkit/components/downloads/nsDownloadManager.cpp).

The specification for how recent documents work on Freedesktop is at:
http://standards.freedesktop.org/recent-file-spec/recent-file-spec-0.2.html

The easiest way of implementing this, though, is probably to use GtkRecentManager, since AFAIK Mozilla uses Gtk on Freedesktop platforms. See
http://developer.gnome.org/gtk/stable/GtkRecentManager.html
http://developer.gnome.org/gtkmm/stable/classGtk_1_1RecentManager.html
In that case, the code is trivial, only a few lines taken from the example.
